Our Impact
The most prevalent prosthetic hand in the world is a hook, technology that hasn’t changed since the 1800s and is unintuitive to control. State-of-the-art hands can be controlled through residual muscles, but cost up to $30000. They also break all the time, are still clumsy to control, and do not give the user any sensory feedback. PSYONIC’s hand solves all these problems while costing less than a tenth in raw materials compared to state-of-the-art commercially available hands.

This is our latest prototype. All 5 fingers can individually flex and extend and the thumb also rotates. Most commercially available hands are large and sized only for males. Ours is 50th percentile female-sized and weighs 20% less than an average human hand. It’s also USB-rechargeable.
 

The hand is controlled through muscle signals from the forearm that are processed by our muscle processing unit. We use a machine learning algorithm that can detect when the user is making different hand movements including hand close, hand open, a fine pinch, a three-finger grasp, and rest. After a quick 2-minute training session, the hand recognizes the different hand movements and responds accordingly.
 

NO commercially available bionic hand gives users useful sensory feedback. We give that ability back to users by using low-cost pressure sensors embedded in the fingertips. These sensors are in everyone’s cell phones and GPS devices, but we repurpose them as highly sensitive touch sensors. When the user touches an object, the skin is stimulated electrically, feeling like a tingling, vibration, or even pressure.
 

After interviewing dozens of clinicians and patients, we found that the number one problem with $30,000 bionic hands is that they are breaking all the time. Our fingers are made of polyurethane and silicone giving them compliance, which allows them to withstand blunt force impacts. Our experiments show that our compliant finger design absorbs at least 10x more energy on impact when compared to fingers using a conventional rigid finger design. In fact, our finger survived impact that not even a 1045 HR steel bar could withstand. Even though they’re flexible, each finger can still hold up to 38 pounds, and the assembled hand can hold over 50 pounds.
 

We’ve already enabled two people with below-elbow amputations with this technology. We met our first patient, Juan Suquillo, in 2014 in Ecuador. He had lost his left hand 30 years prior due to a border war between Ecuador and Peru. After only a couple hours of using one of our first prototypes, he felt as though a part of him had come back. We went back to Ecuador last year with a newer prototype. This was the first time he moved his new prosthesis on his own. He was also able to easily feel light and strong touch from the fingertips on his first try.
 

Earlier this year, we met with Juan again in Ecuador where he used our latest hand to drive a car and pick fruit native to his homeland.
 

In the US, we’ve enabled Retired Army Sgt. Garrett Anderson who lost his right hand due to a roadside bomb in Iraq in 2005. With our technology, he’s now able to grasp eggshells without cracking them while blindfolded. He’s also easily able to grasp cups of water, climb stairs, exercise, and hammer nails into wood.

 

Challenges
Our biggest challenge is getting FDA approval for our hand. Prosthetic hands are categorized as Class II medical devices, which will require at least 6-12 months of extensive testing and consulting in order to get approval. These costs can run up to $100,000. With your contribution, we can get this hand approved in the US, get it covered by insurance, and make it available to patients at no out-of-pocket cost. This will be a huge game changer in the prosthetics industry.
Another challenge is taking our hand from being university research to a commercial product. For that reason, we’ve spent the last 3 months in Shenzhen, China, the electronic hardware capital of the world, furthering our prototypes and optimizing manufacturing for the various components of our hand. To decrease our costs further and make our hand even more affordable for everyone worldwide, we need your help to purchase parts at volume so we can make our first 50 hands and get them on people as soon as possible.
We aim to finish our prototyping and product designs by the end of the year, to obtain FDA approval and insurance coverage in 2018, and to start selling in 2019.
 
What We Need & What You Get
We need your help to make our technology available to the 11.4 million people with hand amputations worldwide. We are asking for $250,000 to help defray the costs of going through FDA approval, getting covered by insurance in the US, finishing our final prototypes, and manufacturing our first 50 hands. Twenty percent will also be going towards Indiegogo fees and rewards.

Our perks can be purchased on the right and are pictured below:

With your contribution, we can change the world, one hand at a time.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, you can still help!

Help us spread the word and let everyone know about our campaign.
Share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter the Indiegogo share tools, as well as Reddit, LinkedIn, Instagram, Google+, and others!

story:
Stevie’s Crazy Garage (SCG) is fanatical about providing high performance parts and quality knowledge transfer videos. With the development of the FlatFast Crankshaft™ kit, SCG will move the automotive street and racing communities into the realm of obtainable European sport car performance and sound zone. Imagine making shifts in your super light V-8 road racer at 9,000 revolutions per minute, or lighting off one of these engines at the local drive-in and cruising Grand Ave.  The new FlatFast Crankshaft™ Kit is a flat plane crankshaft.

What is a Flat Plane Crankshaft (FPC)?

  •   All rod journals embedded in the crankshaft lay in the same  geometrical plane

Examine this illustration below for a better interpretation of a FPC:


Although there are 2 types FPC designs, SCG will use what is commonly called an "Up Down Down Up" design.  Examine the illustration below for more detail.

Why a Flat Plane Crankshaft?

  •  Extremely high RPM – lightweight crankshaft

  •  Even firing order – engine fires evenly from bank to bank

  •  Less shifting at the track – power band is higher and broader

  • Radical exhaust note – this is directly due to the effectiveness of the even firing order

In addition, FPC engines are extremely rare in the American racing market today.  With this campaign and your help, SCG is going change the options available on the American race track.


FPCs can have a vibration problem.  Because of the compression and explosive forces induced into a FPC, the rod journals bend slightly in the direction of rotation. For that short time period, the crankshaft is out of balance.  At a point in the rotation, the rod journal springs back into position producing a ring or harmonic just like a musical note.  All crankshafts have this tendency.  But they are more relevant in an FPC because the bending is being concentrated along a single plane.  SCG will engineer out these vibrations using a propriety guide specification. The goal for this campaign is to design and deliver a tuned rotational kit to maximize horsepower while reducing harmonic rotational vibration.  All the components will be produced here in America by the top rated racing component manufactures. SCG feels that failures at high speed due to inferior quality parts are not acceptable.  The following graphics explains the need for a kit and what comes in a kit.


On the above table is an example of a FlatFast Crankshaft kit.  For the more experienced engine builder,  SCG is examining the possibility of a Crankshaft and Camshaft kit.  It would be up to the engine builder to supply the Pistons, Rods, and Dampener.   For either kit type,  SCG will take customer orders for the crankshafts and camshafts to fit racing rules or power requirements.   But plan well because of the 16 week lead time.


The video link about will provide more info on the workings of a FPC.

SCG has already designed the specifications for the FPC components for several style engine blocks---Ford Coyote, Ford Modular, Ford Windsor---8.2” and 9.5”, Chevrolet LS, Chevrolet Small Block, Toyota 5.7L, Chrysler LA, and Chrysler Gen III Hemi.  The garage needs funding to at least build a prototype.  The prototypes will range from $35,000 to $45,000.  The graphic below is for a Ford Coyote based test engine.  So for the plan of record on development the garage needs $35,000 from backers plus fees to build a FlastFast prototype.

If the garage can reach $170,000 from backers,  a stamp can be built which will reduce the machining cost of the crankshafts by almost half.  This would also include the prototype build for 1 engine.  These are the minimum and best production cost case that the garage needs to move forward.  Each additional $35,000 - $45,000 backer contributions will go to a new prototype.  Four  prototypes are scheduled for now---9.2" Ford Windsor, Coyote, LSx, and Small Block Chevy.  If enough backer contributions are obtained during the campaign---$112,000, a track test car will be built for a prototype engine.  Why is this so expensive?  Well SCG priced several options including buying a low cost and older Camaro or Mustang.  The car would need to be completely rebuilt with expensive new everything.  It does sound fun, but the least expensive option that the garage found was a super car meant for the track.  Yes it's true.  SCG would build an RCR Superlite race car to participate in the Texas Mile and other noteworthy races.  The goal is market the product as actionable, survivable, and available.  The track car will provide this.

The FlatFast product development line can be seen here.



The FPC is not a new idea.  These crankshafts for decades have been the purview of Ferrari, Porsche, and McLaren.  In America, the cross plane crankshaft has been the standard---heavy, lower RPM, mass produced, odd exhaust node.  As a result, American street and racing fanatics have been left out in the cold.  SCG’s goal is to change this decades old paradigm with a choice for street and racing fanatics.  Your contributions will push a new American based initiative on to the street and racing scene for the world.  As a backer to this game changer, you are a team member at Stevie’s Crazy Garage.  But first let’s talk about the contribution target.  The target goal for this crowdfunding paradigm shift is $460,000.  This will cover the development of the components, building of the test mule engines, the test car, awards, fees, and taxes for the campaign.  This contribution level will also place FlatFast Crankshaft Kits into the SCG inventory for 16 weeks which is the time it takes to cut a high quality racing crankshaft.  This target goal is a substantial amount,  and the garage can build prototypes for much less.  But to be clear this contribution goal is the fastest way to the race track.


You can see from the above graph that a full 30% of the contributions go to overhead.  Given the cost of any business endeavor this amount is very fair and SCG is covered for taxes for the 2016 year due to the late time of year for ordering and processing components that do not yet exist.

SCG considers contributors to this campaign to be part of the race team.  Therefore, it only makes sense to setup the award levels in terms of the jobs required by a successful automotive racing team.  SCG created 11 awards unique to the racing industry and 20 levels based losely on race team jobs.  Stevie did not want the awards to be the standard type of fair.  Great intent went into selecting the type of award that would make since to the racing enthusiast.  The quality of the award had to meet the standards of the garage.  SCG was determined to award a higher quality item for its team members. Here are the recently updated awards by item and then by contribution level.



The challenges that face a small garage with a big idea are tremendous.  In this case, the capital required to do the job correctly is high.  SCG may only receive some fraction of the requirement.  Stevie’s Crazy Garage will to do its best to achieve the maximum goals with the contributed capital. The garage will not only do this for the manufacture and testing of the crankshaft kits, but for the contribution awards as well.

Another challenge is that a flat plane crankshaft will take 16 weeks to cut.  The prototypes will take another several weeks to get on the dynamometer for testing.  If the first designs are spot on, the schedule will be easy to meet.  However, if the garage needs to adjust a parameter of the crankshaft itself, then the schedule would slide 16 weeks.  The other components should as camshafts, pins, rods, etc, have a relatively short turn around.  Where there is no risk is that SCG will produce a crankshaft with low vibrations and performance characteristics only seen in European cars today.

Stevie’s Crazy Garage intends to keep its community updated on the progress and news the garage finds in the coming weeks and months.  The reward will be a product that has never been made available on the American market.  It will change the paradigm for the American Racer.  Please join this amazing team today.  If you can’t personally join, help us by shaking the trees for people that would like to join. 

1) Q: What will be the Cubic Inch Displacement?
     A:  To meet the engineering standard at this time, Cubic Inch Displacement will
           not exceed 360 CID.

2) Q: What kind of horsepower are you looking at?
      A: SCG sees the horsepower ratings as naturally aspirated and dependent on 
           the CID, but the garage expects to see 550-650HP at 8500 to 9200 RPM.     
           The crankshafts can exceed 1500+ HP, and the rods with a bolt upgrade will
           do 1500HP.  These ratings are provided for a standard
           cross plane crankshaft.

3) Q: Will the kits support turbo and supercharging?
     A: The kits are made of the best components available and should easily      
          withstand a blower.  However,  custom pistons with a lower compression  
          ratio would need to be ordered.  Also see question #2

story:
The IANH Youth Group

We are the IANH youth group, a non-profit community service group run by high school students based in New Hampshire. Each year, we host cultural events such as the IANH Diwali Festival and IANH Spring Festival, which allow kids in the community to cultivate and showcase talents in dance and music. We also promote education in the community by assisting with IANH bees in topics such as math, science, spelling, and geography. As a youth group, helping other local organization is equally important; each year, we raise money and items to support the local Soup Kitchens and other non-profit charities.

In the past, we have raised thousands of dollars to build solar panels for hostels in India, for Cure with Hope, which aims to brighten hospital stays for kids in New Hampshire, and many other charities. As our group continues to grow, we try to make more profound and positive changes in our community.

What is Our Goal?

This year, our group is hoping to raise at least $3,000 for the Adyar Cancer Institute Foundation. The Adyar Cancer Institute Foundation is an autonomous charitable cancer center. It is a non-profit and non-government. Unfortunately, the institute can’t rely on consistent government funding; it gets most of its financial funding from public philanthropy and aid from foreign organizations.

Adyar Cancer Institute, at Chennai was founded in 1954 by Dr. Muthulakshmi with the support of the Women’s Indian Association (WIA). The organization has been helping patients ever since. The Institute currently has a hospital, research center, center of preventative oncology and a College of Oncology Sciences. The institute has been rated by the World Health Organization (WHO) as the top ranking center in India.

Cancer is curable when it is detected early, and treated rigorously by experts which is why time is significant. About 66% of the patients cannot afford treatment and receive free or subsidized treatment. The funds raised in this campaign will directly help those who can not pay for their treatment.

The Impact

All donations will go directly to patients, and provide the means to screen and test those who cannot afford the treatment. We are raising money to provide  the following treatments for children

Prosthesis : $ 800

Tumor removal (diagnosis, hospitalization and surgery) : $400

MRI Scan : $120

CT Scan : $ 90

Each treatment can help save a person’s life, and any donation is a great aid in the fight against cancer. A donation of any amount would be greatly appreciated, as it can make an immense difference in a person's life.

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help if you cannot donate?

  • Tell your friends and family, and share the Indiegogo link!

Thank you for listening to our story! Also, please feel free to visit our website or email us if you have any questions or concerns.

story:
LISTEN, BREATHE, EVOLVE, EMBODY.

STORY-CENTERED YOGA IN ASHEVILLE, NC

www.narrative-yoga.com


In 2012, I graduated from a 200 hour yoga teacher training that empowered me to begin writing my story. Two years and over ten journals later, I enrolled in a Masters of Arts in Writing program designed to transform its students into soul-centric storytellers who use narrative to heal. As a yogi and past AmeriCorps volunteer, deeply empathic and sensitive to the oppression and suffering in our world, I now seek to blend the arts of writing and healing to launch the Narrative Yoga Project in my new community of Asheville.

Narrative yoga is listening deeply. It is breathing, and thus listening more. It is being moved as the stories we hear unfold from within; it is letting ourselves evolve as they reveal dimensions of our truth. It is embodying this evolution both on the mat and in our world. 

Narrative yoga is part of a new and larger conversation. The importance of narrative is now understood across many disciplines and professions. In some cultures it has never been forgotten.  


NEEDS:

To launch Narrative Yoga in Asheville, NC will require some basic supplies. I plan on offering the pilot classes within the classrooms of Lenior-Rhyne University of Asheville because, after all, LRU is the birthplace of Narrative Yoga. Being the first person to teach yoga at LRU is quite an honor, but it also means that I will need to provide the mats, blankets, and props for this space.   

I intend to purchase these items from ethical companies which utilize fair trade and living wage practices. I am most excited by the bolsters, which will be purchased from Inner Space Yoga, headquartered at The Glowing Body Yoga Studio in Knoxville, TN. I completed my 200 hour RYT at The Glowing Body, and the people who run the space are very special indeed. 

Additionally, I will use the funds to cover my costs for lodging during my continued yoga studies. I complete my 300 hour yoga training in August of 2015, at which time I will be a 500 hour RYT and nearly half way through my Masters degree.

The remaining funds will be applied to those everyday costs of starting up your own lil' business. 

Funds will be broken down in the following ways:

- 10 sets of yoga mats, blankets, and bolsters (10 x $120 per set) = $1200
- Lodging for 3 remaining weekends of 300 hour training (3 x $165 per weekend) = $495
- Reduced-cost business coach from local non-profit entrepreneur education center ($40 per session x 6 sessions) = $240
- New business cards with Narrative Yoga brand = $50 (approx.)
- Indiegogo fees = $300 (approx.)

Any additional funds raised will be applied towards business licensing fees, website development, marketing materials, and home-office organization (e.g. purchasing Quickbooks, invoicing software, office supplies, etc.)


FORWARD MOMENTUM:

This project is answering a very strong call to bring narrative to our fractured modern world. In a culture where there exists police brutality, fear, and misunderstanding, we need story sharing and yoga (or union) more than ever. In a world where people are made to feel small, we need our breath and our bodies to remind us that we are big. I am fortunate to live in a community which fosters this kind of forward momentum and that I possess the gift of being able to birth this project into a supportive environment in which it will thrive. 

In Asheville, the soul-awakening work of Laura Hope-Gill, director of Lenoir-Rhyne University's Narrative Medicine Program, has started the conversation.  It's academic study began formally at Columbia University Medical Center in 2009, and the Center for Narrative Practice will expand on this work thanks to its successful Indiegogo campaign.

My study of yoga continues to be supported, guided, and inspired by the foundational bricks of Kelly Golden's Vira Bhava Yoga training, which dares to explore deeply the subtleties of the practice like no other.

Beyond the supportive structures which exist in my life, I posses other qualifications. I am a 200 hour RYT who is pursuing her 500 hour designation. I have a degree in Spanish, making me capable of one day taking this offering to diverse communities. I also have one year of AmeriCorps experience, during which I faced and grew comfortable navigating the challenging social issues of our time. I used yoga to empower myself during my volunteer experience, and I continue to do so now.


CHALLENGES:

Those who work in the shadow areas where healing and transformation take place are well aware of the challenges one faces on this path. I will have to remember the metaphorical lotus flower, which only blooms in the murkiest and muddiest of waters. My obvious challenges include generating a sustainable income stream and creating partnerships within the community that support this vision. While I have already aligned myself with the organization and teachers listed above, I will have to work at making this project one which sustains itself. I am researching grants and other creative partnerships for this purpose.  I am prepared with patience and also plan on using the Indiegogo campaign funds to hire a low-cost business coach to help me create a solid business plan. I intend to see this project grow into a strong, capable and living entity. 


AS A THANK YOU:

I will remember your donations and offer those who spend $100 or more a space in any workshops and special events that happen within the next year (stay tuned!).


Special note: The featured track in the video is "Teresa's Lullaby" by Sacred Sound Project. Check out their music here.
story_txt:
LISTEN, BREATHE, EVOLVE, EMBODY.STORY-CENTERED YOGA IN ASHEVILLE, NCwww.narrative-yoga.comIn 2012, I graduated from a 200 hour yoga teacher training that empowered me to begin writing my story. Two years and over ten journals later, I enrolled in a Masters of Arts in Writing program designed to transform its students into soul-centric storytellers who use narrative to heal. As a yogi and past AmeriCorps volunteer, deeply empathic and sensitive to the oppression and suffering in our world, I now seek to blend the arts of writing and healing to launch the Narrative Yoga Project in my new community of Asheville.Narrative yoga is listening deeply. It is breathing, and thus listening more. It is being moved as the stories we hear unfold from within; it is letting ourselves evolve as they reveal dimensions of our truth. It is embodying this evolution both on the mat and in our world. Narrative yoga is part of a new and larger conversation. The importance of narrative is now understood across many disciplines and professions. In some cultures it has never been forgotten.  NEEDS:To launch Narrative Yoga in Asheville, NC will require some basic supplies. I plan on offering the pilot classes within the classrooms of Lenior-Rhyne University of Asheville because, after all, LRU is the birthplace of Narrative Yoga. Being the first person to teach yoga at LRU is quite an honor, but it also means that I will need to provide the mats, blankets, and props for this space.   
I intend to purchase these items from ethical companies which utilize fair trade and living wage practices. I am most excited by the bolsters, which will be purchased from Inner Space Yoga, headquartered at The Glowing Body Yoga Studio in Knoxville, TN. I completed my 200 hour RYT at The Glowing Body, and the people who run the space are very special indeed. 
Additionally, I will use the funds to cover my costs for lodging during my continued yoga studies. I complete my 300 hour yoga training in August of 2015, at which time I will be a 500 hour RYT and nearly half way through my Masters degree.The remaining funds will be applied to those everyday costs of starting up your own lil' business. Funds will be broken down in the following ways:- 10 sets of yoga mats, blankets, and bolsters (10 x $120 per set) = $1200
- Lodging for 3 remaining weekends of 300 hour training (3 x $165 per weekend) = $495
- Reduced-cost business coach from local non-profit entrepreneur education center ($40 per session x 6 sessions) = $240- New business cards with Narrative Yoga brand = $50 (approx.)- Indiegogo fees = $300 (approx.)
Any additional funds raised will be applied towards business licensing fees, website development, marketing materials, and home-office organization (e.g. purchasing Quickbooks, invoicing software, office supplies, etc.)
FORWARD MOMENTUM:This project is answering a very strong call to bring narrative to our fractured modern world. In a culture where there exists police brutality, fear, and misunderstanding, we need story sharing and yoga (or union) more than ever. In a world where people are made to feel small, we need our breath and our bodies to remind us that we are big. I am fortunate to live in a community which fosters this kind of forward momentum and that I possess the gift of being able to birth this project into a supportive environment in which it will thrive. 
In Asheville, the soul-awakening work of Laura Hope-Gill, director of Lenoir-Rhyne University's Narrative Medicine Program, has started the conversation.  It's academic study began formally at Columbia University Medical Center in 2009, and the Center for Narrative Practice will expand on this work thanks to its successful Indiegogo campaign.
My study of yoga continues to be supported, guided, and inspired by the foundational bricks of Kelly Golden's Vira Bhava Yoga training, which dares to explore deeply the subtleties of the practice like no other.
Beyond the supportive structures which exist in my life, I posses other qualifications. I am a 200 hour RYT who is pursuing her 500 hour designation. I have a degree in Spanish, making me capable of one day taking this offering to diverse communities. I also have one year of AmeriCorps experience, during which I faced and grew comfortable navigating the challenging social issues of our time. I used yoga to empower myself during my volunteer experience, and I continue to do so now.

CHALLENGES:Those who work in the shadow areas where healing and transformation take place are well aware of the challenges one faces on this path. I will have to remember the metaphorical lotus flower, which only blooms in the murkiest and muddiest of waters. My obvious challenges include generating a sustainable income stream and creating partnerships within the community that support this vision. While I have already aligned myself with the organization and teachers listed above, I will have to work at making this project one which sustains itself. I am researching grants and other creative partnerships for this purpose.  I am prepared with patience and also plan on using the Indiegogo campaign funds to hire a low-cost business coach to help me create a solid business plan. I intend to see this project grow into a strong, capable and living entity. 
AS A THANK YOU:
I will remember your donations and offer those who spend $100 or more a space in any workshops and special events that happen within the next year (stay tuned!).


Special note: The featured track in the video is "Teresa's Lullaby" by Sacred Sound Project. Check out their music here.

story:
"BIG PHARMA's definition of success: Billions in the bank, no effective treatment. #fightneurodegeneration"

Retweet if you agree, be sure to include the link to this project in the tweet... let's get the word out.

OUR APPROACH TO FIGHTING NEURODEGENERATION IS GUIDED BY 3 BASIC PRINCIPLES:
1. Big Pharma's search for "novel" compounds to fight neurodegenerative diseases are wasteful and are a reflection of their greed, not a result of there being a lack of known compounds that has shown neuroprotective qualities.
2. All neurodegenerative diseases are metabolic diseases with multiple causative pathological pathways, which are in the end irrelevant in the search for a cure. What is important is not what causes neurodegeneration, but what sustains it. We need to address the 'sustaining' pathological pathways such as oxidative stress, protein & DNA mutation, aberrant inflammation, demyelation, impaired autophagy, insulin resistance, transition metal ions build-up, cholesterol build-up, liver ceramides build-up and more.
3. All neurodegenerative diseases (e.g. ALS,Alzheimer's, Huntington, Parkinson's MS, MSA, etc.,) are all the same disease, just presenting in different sections of the CNS with different contributing weights/impacts from the causative pathological pathways.

In preclinical research (using cell lines and animal models), researchers have tested many organic compounds (e.g.Trehalose, Curcumin and others) and found many that showed promising potential for reducing neurodegeneration by removing β-amyloid, prion build-up and calming down excited microglia cells in the brain (these are the immune cells of the brain that when activated attacks the brain cells that are damaged, continues attacks eventually kill the neurons, even those that were healthy).  Trehalose is the sugar used to sweeten chewing gum.

That's the good news... there are known compounds effective in dealing with neurodegeneration.

*Trehalose alleviates polyglutamine-mediated pathology in a mouse model of Huntington disease Tanaka et al 2004.
*Inhibition of Protease-Resistant Prion Protein Accumulation In Vitro by Curcumin Caughey et al., 2003.
*Can trehalose prevent neurodegeneration? Insights from experimental studies Emanuele 2014.

The not so good news is that the extremely low oral bioavailability (it does not get into your body becuase it's brokendown in your stomach) of these natural compounds prevents them from being used effectively by everyday citizens to fight neurodegeneration and protect their brain cells from further decay.

Currently there are no treatments available (natural or otherwise) to address the underlying issues causing neurodegenerative diseases. A successful project could be a lifeline for millions of people suffering from such debilitating diseases, while giving hope to those worried about eventually developing such diseases themselves.

Despite the not so good news, there is reason to be hopeful, because at least, now we know that there are viable candidate compounds available to protect brain cells. Compounds that if optimized, may be just the ticket toward effective neuronal protection.

Here are some more good news.

The techniques required to take these natural compounds from potential candidates to actual therapies already exists and are in everyday use in the pharmaceutical industry - techniques such as  thin film barrier coatings, particle size modifications (in the nanoscale size range), surface modification and complexation.

Big pharma if properly motivated can have therapies that include these compounds on the market in months.

Unfortunately, the pharmaceutical industrial complex isn't interest in bringing these natural compounds to market. They cannot patent these natural compounds and make embarrassingly large monopolistic profits on them by way of a protected patent. A chewing gum sweetener (Trehalose) is just not going to generate for them the humongous profits they've grown entitled to. Additionally, these compounds would compete with the expensive drugs they currently have on the market (many of which are not very effective but still costs a bundle).

Here is the really good news... this is the age of the social internet, where sites like Indiegogo allow the small guys to pool their resources and do things the big guys can't or won't. With this project, you finally have your say on the development of these natural compounds into effective neuroprotective agents. 

YOU HAVE THE POWER!

Herein, we are proposing a project to take these compounds from ideation to finish therapeutic agents and we need your help, both financially and in spreading the word.

The essence of the overall project is to take thirty plus compounds that showed the highest potentials as neuroprotective agents and complex them into a multi-functional therapeutic agent to fight neurodegeneration and enhance neuroprotection.

The project will be broken down into four phases to maximize the chance of overall success. Summary of each phase appears immediately below, while full details appears further down in their own sections.

  • Phase One: Develop proof of concept bioparticles containing the least bioavailable compound (Trehalose) to demonstrate an optimized oral bioavailability (Budget $20,000).
  • Phase Two: Bioparticle Optimization to ensure that the particle can transit the blood brain barrier (BBB) and is not cytotoxic (Budget $25,000).
  • Phase Three: Convert the bioparticle into a multi-functional therapeutic agent by adding the other thirty plus compounds to the Trehalose already in the bioparticle, while maintaining bioavialability and the ability to pass the BBB. (Budget $90,000).
  • Phase Four: Assess efficacy of the multi-functional therapeutic agent against various neurodegenerative disease states (Overall budget $225,000).


Remember... what we are trying to achieve is not being done by 'big pharma' and we need your help, even if you do not have funds to contribute you can still help by getting the word out. Let us get these compounds off the shelf and into the hands of those who need them fast, because once you lose a neuron, it's lost forever!

    Other Ways to Help
  • Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to the left to spread the word.
  • Link to this page from Facebook or Twitter.
  • Email the link to this page or the accompanying video to a friend.
  • Tweet and ask those who are in your network to re-tweet your tweet about this project.
You just never know who may benefit, since those suffering from neurodegeneration do not go around and advertise that fact, but your tweets, emails and link sharing may be able to reach someone who will benefit from this project, so please share liberally and often.
 


A little note on the provided perks. brainJOLT!™ the NHP being given away in the featured perk, is an NHP developed for a friend who had extreme fatigued, she has since been diagnosed with MS. brainJOLT!™ worked so well that its capabilities were extended and submitted for Health Canada for approval. It is now the only Health Canada approved NHP with a claim to boost working memory, additional approved claims includes reducing fatigue and making the body resistance to stress. Anyone suffering from extreme fatigue needs brainJOLT!™ to get through their day, it is extremely effective and has no side-effects.

TumorDefence™, our newest NHP is currently undergoing Health Canada review for sale in Canadian stores. TumorDefence™ is only available via the "I Hate Cancer" perk. It works by modulating the immune system to aggressively go after tumor cells even if they have metastasized, regardless of cancer type. If you know anyone with cancer looking for an additional tool, please point them to the "I Hate Cancer" perk, it could save their lives.

Additionally, you may have noticed, we have classified the perks into different "umbrella" categories such as Well Wishers, Advocates & Champions. The classifications broadly speaking dictates the discounts projected based on estimated materials cost and imputed retail price on the final product. 

The Theoretical Effective Dose (TED) is 20 grams and is to be taken by dissolution in water or juice. The TED is computed by including all ingredients at their individually demonstrated effective dosages as reported in preclinical and epidemiological research.

It is our belief that the Actual Effective Dose (AED), consisting of over thirty compounds working synergistically together, will be significantly lower than the TED. AED will be calculated once animal efficacy studies are concluded and we make adjustments for animal vs. human metabolic rate.

The specific projected discounts per perk is as follows:

Well Wishers - Bronze, Silver, Gold: N/A (MfT-A not provided)
Advocates - Bronze: 10% Discount
Advocates - Silver: 15% Discount
Advocates - Gold: 20% Discount
Advocates - Platinum: 25% Discount
Champions - Gold: 30% Discount
Champions - Platinum: 35% Discount
Clinical Trial Pack: 40% Discount

"The remainder of this project outline is somewhat more technical and is here for those backers who are interested in understanding the nitty-gritty science behind the project, everyone else is encouraged to proceed to the funding tab and lend us your assistance.

Thanks in advance..."
Garfield

Natural health products' (NHP) capacity to address neurodegeneration is well documented in the scientific literature. This should not be surprising since the increase in neurodegenerative diseases followed revolutionary changes in Western diets that resulted in an exponential rise in the consumption of highly processed foods, which either lack the appropriate nutrients for long-term support of the central nervous system (CNS) and systemic metabolic functions, or contain added ingredients that impair protective actions of natural food substances. (Moving forward with nutrition in Alzheimer's disease. Scheltens, 2009)

Current research in academia are leading to a greater understanding of the underlying pathologies causing many neurodegenerative diseases including Alzheimer's disease (AD), Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS), Multiple Sclerosis (MS) and Parkinson’s disease.

Implicated in the pathogenesis of neurodegenerative diseases, is the compromise of the Mitochondria via an overproduction of reactive oxygen species (ROS), which leads to oxidative damage. ROS (e.g. superoxides and hydrogen peroxide) are created during respiration - the process by which cells convert the nutrients we consume into energy, specifically Adenosine triphosphate (ATP). Respiration itself takes place in the Mitochondria.

Impairment of the Mitochondria leads to reduce ATP production and increased ROS production. This in turn leads to cellular inflammation, protein aggregation,  mutant DNA formation, as well as other neurodegenerations. As a result of these neurodegenerative processes, the body's own immune system get turned against the impaired neuronal cells, causing further damages that can lead to neuronial demyelination and eventually cell death. (Mitochondrial Medicine for Aging and Neurodegenerative Diseases. Reddy, 2008; Is multiple sclerosis a mitochondrial disease? Mao et al., 2009).

Another fascinating finding from preclinical research is that excessive cholestrol build-up in brain tissue resembles early stage Alzheimer's disease (Increasing membrane cholesterol of neurons in culture recapitulates Alzheimer’s disease early phenotypes. Marquer et al. 2014)

Interestingly, if neurogenerative diseases are actual metabolic diseases, it's possible that they have their origins not in the brain, but rather in a distant organ, namely the liver. Ceramides build-up in the liver can migrate to the brain where it causes insulin insensitivity. Insulin is an extremely important hormone that's produced in the pancreas and which is involved in numerous metabolic processes, including ATP production in the Mitochondria  (Sphingolipids, insulin resistance, and metabolic disease: new insights from in vivo manipulation of sphingolipid metabolism.  Holland et al. 2008).

Ceramides are are a family of waxy lipid molecules containing, sphingolipids, which are toxic to neuronal cells. They are lipid signaling molecules that cause
insulin resistance by activating pro-inflammatory cytokines. (Insulin-like growth factor-1-dependent maintenance of neuronal metabolism through the phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase-Akt pathway is inhibited by C2-ceramide in CAD cells. Gibson 2007)

A final note on ceramides, if you have neurodegeneration and don't think ceramides are implicated, you may want to answer this question. Do you have Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NFLD); this is where you have an apparent beer belly without being a major beer drinker? NFLD is a dysfunction of the liver, and long before your gut started protruding, your liver was pumping out ceramides into your brain, (Role of Ceramides in Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease Pagadala et al. 2012)

That initial insulin insensitivity brought on by the invading ceramides from the liver could be what starts the entire neurodegeneration cascade. That nudge causes the Mitochondria to misfire like a sputtering engine producing too much smoke (ROS) for the antioxidants in the cells to extinguish and not enough power (ATP) to give each cellular component enough energy to execute their respective tasks (the brain only makes up 2% of our body mass, but consumes 20% of the energy our body produces). Once the process builds up steam, it becomes like a runaway train or an avalanche.

 


Why should you believe that we can successfully complete this project?

Well, in one word... EXPERIENCED!

Put simply, we have traveled this developmental pathway before, successfully.

COORGA Nutraceuticals is one of the relative few US registered dietary supplements developers with products sold in stores in Canada. This is because all natural health products (NHP) legally sold in Canada must first receive a license from Health Canada. Before such license are granted, the NHP undergoes an extensive review to assess both its efficacy and safety.  Health Canada is widely regarded as one of the toughest regulators of NHP with an approval rate of 40% as of 2010, the last time figures were available.

COORGA Nutraceuticals has developed some innovative treatments in the past despite an environment replete with naysayers.

  • TumorDefence™, is a NHP we developed as an adjuvant treatment for chemo and radiation therapy, with an indication for fighting cancer metastasis. It employs the body's own immune capacity to fight tumor growth. TumorDefence™ is currently undergoing Health Canada evaluation for sale in Canada.
    **Those looking for an effective therapeutic tool to complement  their current treatment regime to target tumors, should check out the "I hate Cancer"  perk to the right.**
  • Our product brainJOLT!™, was first developed for a good friend who was always complaining about feeling incredibly fatigued, unfortunately, she has since been diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis. She is also the reason we decided to tackle the problem of neurodegeneration; we have no desired to see her confined to a wheelchair, especially not when we have the capabilities to prevent it from happening. brainJOLT!™ worked so well for her that we expanded its capabilities to boost short-term working memory among other things. Today brainJOLT!™ is the only NHP approved by Health Canada  with an indication to boost working memory, not just the wish-washy claim of "supporting" working memory, our product actually boosts it.
    • ** Do you have a neurodegenerative disease that leaves you fatigued all the time? Then check out the featured perk "Perk Me Up, I am Fatigued" to the right.**
  • Finally, we were the first to develop a dietary supplement (Grey Defence®) shown to reverse greying, for which we have a US patent. This product was also approved by Health Canada to re-mediate cellular oxidative stress and lipid peroxidation caused by reactive oxygen species (ROS). This product works best for people who started greying within 7 years of when they started using it. Essentially, normal greying is due to oxidative stress and lipid peroxidation caused by ROS (specifically, hydrogen peroxide) build-up at the base of the hair follicle. The hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) bleaches the follicle as it grows while preventing the hair from being able to repair itself. Removing the H2O2 stops these processes and since the hair follicle is still producing melanin, hair color returns overtime. For those following closely, you will note the similarity in terms of ROS dysfunction remediation approved for Grey Defence® as those proposed herein. The main difference being that Grey Defence® targets oxidative stress in hair follicle cells, while the multi-functional therapeutic agent will target oxidative stress in neuronal cells.
Despite the achievements listed above, you should be aware that the FTC has sued COORGA Nutraceuticals and its principals, claiming there is no scientific basis for our products. Yeah... we don't understand their thinking either, even if they think our conclusions are wrong (though they aren't), this still does not make what we are doing not science. After all science, is a methodology, that's why it's oft referred to as the scientific method (oh well. maybe they think we are doing voodoo or something else magical). At any rate, we have refused their offer to settle out of court and are aggressively defending our products and our good name in court.

It's important to keep in mind that this project is one that is a research and development (R&D) effort. R&D by its nature is risky and this one is no different. Specific risks to consider are:

  • The inability to overcome the inherent limitations of the compounds in question, as a result, failing in our effort to optimize their oral bioavailability to create an enhanced bioparticle that survives travel through the digestive system.
  • Even if we create an enhance bioparticle, this particle may be such that it fails to transit the blood brain barrier (BBB). Failure to transit the BBB means that the bioparticle would not be able to get into the neurons to deliver its payloads.
  • Even if the bioparticle is efficient at transiting the BBB and releasing its payload, that payload may be ineffective in initiating any useful therapeutic effects with regard to neurodegeneration.
  • Finally, even if the bioparticle efficiently transit the BBB, delivers an effective payload that remediate certain aspects of neurodegeneration, the bioparticle itself or the compounds it contains, may be cytotoxic, making it a poor therapy overall.

To address these risks and challenges we have divided the overall project into four (4) primary phases outlined below.

 


PHASE ONE
BioParticle Development
Budget: $20,000

In this first phase of the project, we will seek to develop a highly orally bioavailable bioparticle containing Trehalose. 

In lab experiments on animal models, the injection of Trehalose has been shown to significantly increase autophagy. Trehalose is the sugar used to sweeten chewing gum. Unfortunately, when taken orally, it is broken down within the stomach, the intestine and blood serum to glucose, loosing any inherent therapeutic value long before it can get anywhere near the central nervous system. 

Autophagy is how cells rid themselves of unwanted debris such as damaged proteins, microorganisms, etc.


Trehalose is aggressively digested and converted into glucose, this occurs in the stomach, the intestines and blood serum. Oral supplementation with Trehalose leads to negligible serum/cellular bioavailability.


The goal of this initial step is to develop a biocompatible, bioavailable particle that mostly survives the journey through the digestive tract intact.

Milestone:
1) Lab report from third party lab showing whether the bioparticles successfully exists the digestive tract and enters the body proper.

PHASE TWO
Bio-Particle Optimization
Budget: $25,000

The molecules of natural health products are not renown for their ability to transist the BBB because they are generally too large and too insoluble. Big pharma employs techniques such as nanorization (particle size in the nanometer range) and surface modifications to make drugs better able to transit the BBB, these techniques are well documented in the scientific literature.


Neuronal cells are cordon off by the BBB and presents a challenge for NHP compounds to transit. 


The goal of this phase is to optimize the bioparticle such that it can efficiently transit the BBB. As in the previous phase, we will be drawing heavily on well documented pharmaceutical manufacturing techniques to help us optimized the bioparticle for efficient BBB transit.

Milestone: Third party Lab reports using animal models to:
1) Optimized bioparticle that transits the BBB.
2) Pharmacokinetic study assessing the toxicological profile of the Optimized bioparticle.

PHASE THREE
Fully Multi-functional Therapeutic Agent (MfT-A)
Budget: $90,000

One very important conclusion that can be drawn from a review of current research in neurodegenerative diseases is that the concept of using mono-therapy (a Big Pharma preference, using patented compounds) to treat neurodegernation is wrong, and instead, multiple targets must be attacked simultaneously and over a prolonged period of time. (Why pleiotropic interventions are needed for Alzheimer's disease, Frautschy et al. 2010).

This is where the multi-functional therapeutic agent comes in.

In this phase of the project, the previously optimized bioparticles will be complexed with other compounds to develop a multi-functional therapeutic agent to slow, stop and/or reverse the underlying pathological pathways that leads to neurodegeneration.

Specifically we will be adding Superoxide Dismutase (SOD), Curcumin, Catalase and thirty additional compounds to the original Trehalose bioparticle.


Neurodegeneration does not have only one causatory element, therefore attacking only on a single dimension (e.g. aberrant inflammatory response) will not be sufficient. The problem needs to be attacked from multiple angles to reflect the multiple pathways to possible dysfunctions (e.g. oxidative stress, protein & DNA mutation, aberrant inflammation, demyelation, impaired autophagy, insulin resistance, transition metal ions build-up, cholesterol build-up, liver ceramides build-up, activated microglia macrophages, etc.). The additional thirty plus compounds were selected because in preclinical or clinical research they showed either a moderate to significant impact on one of these causative elements.


In this phase we will broaden out the therapy to include additional key natural compounds that addresses additional areas that leads to neurodegeneration.

Milestone:
1) Multi-functional therapeutic agent.
2) Toxicology safety report on multi-functional therapeutic agent.

PHASE FOUR
Assess Multi-functional Therapeutic Agent Against Disease Models
Budget: (see sub-phase)

Sub-phase
a) Alzheimer's disease = $150,000
b) Multiple Sclerosis = $75,000

This, the validation stage is where the rubber hits the road. In this phase we try to answer the question as to whether the multi-functional therapeutic agent we developed through phases 1 - 3 is able to preform as an effective advanced neuroprotectant & neurodegeneration remediator.  To help us to answer this question we will employ two (2) classical models of neurodegeneration, namely the Alzheimer's disease animal model and the Multiple Sclerosis disease animal model


The multi-functional therapeutic agent (MfT-A) will be a dietary supplement not a drug, as a result, there are legal restrictions placed on what can be claimed.

In the US, a dietary supplement cannot claim to prevent, treat or cure any specific disease.

In Canada, all dietary supplements must receive pre-approval from Health Canada before they can be sold. As a result of this more rigorous approval process, dietary supplements (NHPs) are permitted to make disease prevention, treatment and cure claims to the general public. However, Canada has a blanket prohibition on any drug, device, food or NHP from making any treatment or cure claims covering a limited list of diseases found on Schedule A of the Canadian Food and Drug Act, these are generally referred to as Schedule A Diseases. Prohibitions notwithstanding, with approval, a NHP may be permitted to make disease prevention claims for a Schedule A disease. Please note, these prohibitions on Schedule A diseases are only for marketing and advertising to the general public and do not apply to health care practitioners (e.g. doctors, pharmacists, etc.).

The goal, therefore, of the preclinical studies will be to assess whether the MfT-A have any impact on the underlying neurodegeneration that can cause these diseases and not whether it treats the diseases themselves.

    Therefore the questions we hope to answer in each mouse model concerning the neurodegeneration are:
  1. Does the MfT-A accelerate the removal of mutant/damage proteins, damaged or inactivated mitochondria, etc.?
  2. Does the MfT-A reduce oxidative stress and lipid peroxidation markers?
  3. Does the MfT-A reduces the markers for aberrant inflammation and inappropriate cytokine activation?
  4. Does the MfT-A enhances remyelation of neuronal cells?
  5. Does the MfT-A reduces the amount of ceramides present in the brain?
  6. Does the MfT-A bring about an increase in the average survival time of treated animals as compared to controls?
  7. Does the MfT-A bring about an improvement in social measures for the animals (more happy, energetic, etc.)?
  8. What is the appropriate dose to see an impact (low, medium, high)?


Milestone: Lab reports answering the questions above on each disease state reviewed.

Checkout the free ONLINE COGNITIVE HEALTH SUMMIT 2015 an industry forum event that we recommend anyone who is interested in this topic to review. There are many insightful presentations that you will benefit from. This event is not associated with our company in any way.

patent. A chewing gum sweetener (Trehalose) is just not going to generate for them the humongous profits they've grown entitled to. Additionally, these compounds would compete with the expensive 
drugs they currently have on the market (many of which are not very 
effective but still costs a bundle).
Here is the really good news... this
 is the age of the social internet, where sites like Indiegogo allow the
 small guys to pool their resources and do things the big guys can't or won't.
 With this project, you finally have your say on the development of 
these natural compounds into effective neuroprotective agents.  YOU HAVE THE POWER!
Herein, we are proposing a project to take these compounds from ideation
 to finish therapeutic agents and we need your help, both financially 
and in spreading the word. 

The
 essence of the overall project is to take thirty plus compounds that 
showed the highest potentials as neuroprotective agents and complex them
 into a multi-functional therapeutic agent to fight neurodegeneration 
and enhance neuroprotection.

The project will be broken down into 
four phases to maximize the chance of overall success. Summary of each 
phase appears immediately below, while full details appears further down
 in their own sections.



Phase One: Develop proof of concept bioparticles containing the 
least bioavailable compound (Trehalose) to demonstrate an optimized oral
 bioavailability (Budget $20,000). 

Phase Two: Bioparticle Optimization to ensure that the particle 
can transit the blood brain barrier (BBB) and is not cytotoxic (Budget 
$25,000). 

Phase Three: Convert the bioparticle into a multi-functional 
therapeutic agent by adding the other thirty plus compounds to the 
Trehalose already in the bioparticle, while maintaining bioavialability 
and the ability to pass the BBB. (Budget $90,000).

Phase Four: Assess efficacy of the multi-functional therapeutic 
agent against various neurodegenerative disease states (Overall budget 
$225,000).

Remember...
 what we are trying to achieve is not being done by 'big pharma' and we 
need your help, even if you do not have funds to contribute you can 
still help by getting the word out. Let us get these compounds off the 
shelf and into the hands of those who need them fast, because once you 
lose a neuron, it's lost forever!


Other Ways to HelpUse the Indiegogo sharing tools to the left to spread the word.
Link to this page from Facebook or Twitter.
Email the link to this page or the accompanying video to a friend.
Tweet and ask those who are in your network to re-tweet your tweet about this project. 
You just never know who may benefit, since those suffering from 
neurodegeneration do not go around and advertise that fact, but your 
tweets, emails and link sharing may be able to reach someone who will 
benefit from this project, so please share liberally and often. A
 little note on the provided perks. brainJOLT!™ the NHP being given away in the featured perk, is an NHP developed for a friend who had extreme fatigued, she has since been diagnosed with MS. brainJOLT!™ worked so well that its capabilities were extended and submitted for Health Canada for approval. It is now the only Health Canada approved NHP with a claim to boost working memory, additional approved claims includes reducing fatigue and making the body resistance to stress. Anyone suffering from extreme fatigue needs brainJOLT!™ to get through their day, it is extremely effective and has no side-effects.
TumorDefence™, our newest NHP is currently undergoing Health Canada review for sale in Canadian stores. TumorDefence™ is only available via the "I Hate Cancer" perk. It works by modulating the immune system to aggressively go after tumor cells even if they have metastasized, regardless of cancer type. If you know anyone with cancer looking for an additional tool, please point them to the "I Hate Cancer" perk, it could save their lives.
Additionally, you may have noticed, we have 
classified the perks into different "umbrella" categories such as Well 
Wishers, Advocates & Champions. The classifications broadly speaking
 dictates the discounts projected based on estimated materials cost and 
imputed retail price on the final product.  The Theoretical Effective Dose (TED) is 20 grams and is to be 
taken by dissolution in water or juice. The TED is computed by including
 all ingredients at their individually demonstrated effective dosages as reported in preclinical and epidemiological research. 

It is our belief that the Actual Effective Dose (AED), consisting of over thirty compounds working synergistically together,
 will be significantly lower than the TED. AED will be calculated once 
animal efficacy studies are concluded and we make adjustments for animal
 vs. human metabolic rate.

Advocates - Bronze: 10% Discount
